thread.title: Super Bowl 51: Anti-Trump protesters march near NRG Stadium
thread.title_full: Super Bowl 51: Anti-Trump protesters march near NRG Stadium

author: Brandon Schlager (bschlager@sportingnews.com)
title: Super Bowl 51: Anti-Trump protesters march near NRG Stadium
text:
February 5, 2017 6:25pm EST February 5, 2017 6:25pm EST American Football, News, English, NFL, Atlanta Falcons, New England Patriots, Super Bowl Several hundred people protesting the presidency of Donald Trump gathered near NRG Stadium hours before kickoff. Protesters gather near NRG Stadium (Getty Images) 
Updated at 6:25 p.m. ET 
Updated at 6:25 p.m. ET 
Several hundred people protesting the presidency of Donald Trump gathered near NRG Stadium, site of Super Bowl 51, hours before Sunday's kickoff. 
At noon, an estimated crowd of 500 demonstrators assembled in a park about two miles from the stadium with plans march on the Super Bowl, according to the Houston Chronicle . 
The group held pro-equality signs supporting the "Black Lives Matter" movement or condemning Trump's recent immigration order. As they marched, protesters chanted, “Hey, hey, ho, ho, Donald Trump has got to go," along the route to the stadium. Trump protest covers several blocks outside NRG stadium as guest arrive for #SB51 pic.twitter.com/fGAahVLsmT — Dylan Baddour (@DylanBaddour) February 5, 2017 Protesters and Super Bowl visitors yell at each other about president Trump pic.twitter.com/eMqGkZiMOO — Dylan Baddour (@DylanBaddour) February 5, 2017 Protesters chant: "hands too small, cant build a wall!" pic.twitter.com/ZDfE9xUm98 — Dylan Baddour (@DylanBaddour) February 5, 2017 
In an interview with Fox Sports broadcast before the game, Trump predicted the Patriots would defeat the Falcons, but he was not expected to attend the game. 
Instead, Vice President Mike Pence represented the White House among the 73,000 fans at NRG Stadium. Watch This
